name: Asian Religions BA
overview: Early acquisition of Asian language skills aids in the timely completion of major requirements and enriches appreciation of Asian cultures. Students are encouraged, therefore, to complete up to a year of language study in approved programs of study abroad.

requirements.title: Intermediate Sequence of Asian Language
requirements.description: Select one intermediate sequence in one Asian language offered by the department (e.g., courses listed or equivalent):

requirements.title: Asian 30 or Introduction to Religions Course

sections.title: The Major
sections.description: Complete eleven upper-division courses as follows:

requirements.title: Upper-Division Language Courses
requirements.description: Complete three upper-division language courses in one Asian language offered by the department.

requirements.title: Upper-Division Asian Religions Courses
requirements.description: Complete six upper-division Asian religions courses within the department, including at least one course each concerning religions in China, Japan, Korea, and either South Asia or Southeast Asia.

requirements.title: Electives
requirements.description: Complete two electives within the department.

sections.title: Honors Program
sections.description: The honors program is a three-term sequence, taken in addition to requirements for the major, that culminates in the submission of a 40- to 60-page thesis. The honors program is open to majors with a 3.5 grade-point average in upper-division courses in the major and a 3.0 overall GPA.

requirements.title: Honors Program Courses
requirements.description: This is an optional program. Complete the three-term sequence.

options.title: Honors Thesis Sequence
options.description: Complete all three courses in the honors research sequence.
